claims.object: Connecting many devices using simple point-to-point serial links

surface_layer.definition: A hierarchical structure used in USB connections to connect multiple devices to a single host.
common_uses: Connecting USB devices to a computer
Expanding the number of available USB ports

deep_layer.mechanism: Each hub in the tree structure acts as a node, allowing devices to be connected in a cascading fashion.
deep_layer.origin: Designed to overcome the limitations of connecting devices with point-to-point connections.

examples: Connecting multiple USB drives to a computer using a USB hub

capabilities: Routing data between devices and the host
